sen.j: 江戸時代になると、富士山の登拜が庶民の間でも広く行なわれるようになった。
sen.e: In the Edo period, climbing Mt. Fuji for worship became widely popular among commoners.

sen.j: これは戦国時代 (日本)から江戸時代初期（16世紀後半から17世紀前半）に富士山麓の人穴で修行した角行藤仏（天文 (日本)10年(1541年）-正保3年（1646年）がおこなった富士信仰から始まるとされる。
sen.e: This practice is believed to have begun as the worship of Mt. Fuji exercised by Tobutsu KAKUGYO (1541 - 1646) who conducted ascetic practices in a cave at the foot of Mt. Fuji from the Sengoku period (period of warring states) to the beginning of the Edo period (from the latter half of the 16th century to the early half of the 17th century).

sen.j: 庶民は富士山への信仰を強くし、特に江戸の各地には富士山を遥拝する富士塚が多く作られた。
sen.e: As a result, commoners came to strongly worship Mt Fuji, and many Fujizuka mounds for worship of Mt. Fuji from afar were built at various parts of Edo.

sen.j: 富士塚は土を盛って作られた人工の小さな山で、富士山がよく見えるところに作られ、山頂には浅間神社が祀られた。
sen.e: Fujizuka mounds are artificial mounds constructed by filling up earth and were built at places that can command Mt. Fuji, and Sengen Shrine was built atop those mounds.
Fujizuka mounds are artificial mounds constructed by filling up earth and were built at places that can command Mt. Fuji, and Sengen-taisha Shrine was built atop those mounds.

sen.j: 富士塚は、富士山に行くことが出来ない人たちでも擬似的に富士山の登拜を体験することができるようにするものである。
sen.e: Those mounds were designed to allow people who couldn't visit Mt. Fuji to experience climbing Mt. Fuji and worship it on a simulated manner.

sen.j: こうした富士山信仰の高まりを受け、江戸時代には富士山信仰を基盤とした神仏混交の新宗教が多数登場した。
sen.e: In response to the growing popularity of Mt. Fuji worship, various new religions mixing Shintoism and Buddhist based on the Mt. Fuji worship were born in the Edo period.

sen.j: 新宗教は江戸で布教を行い富士講を組織して、江戸幕府にとっても無視できない規模になることもあり、幕府が富士講禁制の町触を出すこともしばしばであった。
sen.e: Those new religions conducted missionary work in Edo and formed Fujiko confraternities, and some such groups became too big to be ignored by the Edo shogunate government, which eventually announced directives to prohibit formation of Fujiko confraternities repeatedly.

sen.j: 例えば、1774年から1849年に、江戸町奉行所は7回の禁制の町触を出している。
sen.e: For example, the Edo Magistrate's Office announced the directive to prohibit Fujiko seven times from 1774 to 1849.

sen.j: これらの新宗教は明治期の激動を潜り抜け、今でも実行教・丸山教・扶桑教などと脈絡を保ち続いている。
sen.e: Some of those new religions still survived the hard days of the Meiji era and are still operating, which include such groups as Jikko-kyo, Maruyama-kyo and Fuso-kyo.
